Material Information Summary: Larvotto Resources (ASX: LRV) – Hillgrove Project Presentation

Project & Funding

Like a classic mining financing, this project is now fully funded.
- Final Investment Decision (FID) approved (31 July 2025) for Hillgrove Antimony-Gold Project (NSW).
- Funding secured:
- US$105M Senior Secured Bond (closed 21 July 2025).
- A$60M Equity Placement (closed 25 July 2025).
- Target production start: Q2 2026.

Definitive Feasibility Study (DFS) Highlights

  • Ore Reserve: 636koz AuEq @ 6.6g/t (636,000 oz)
  • Resource: 1.7Moz AuEq @ 7.4g/t (1,700,000 oz)
  • Mid-case economics (Gold US$2,850/oz, Antimony US$41,000/t):
  • NPV (post-tax, 8%): A$694M
  • IRR: 102%
  • Payback: 11 months
  • LOM EBITDA (avg): A$251M/year
  • Spot price upside: NPV A$1.27B (Gold US$3,300/oz, Antimony US$57,000/t).

Strategic Positioning

  • Critical mineral play: Producing 7% of global antimony supply (China-dominated market).
  • Offtake signed: 7-year agreement with Wogen Resources.

Corporate Snapshot (as of 1 Aug 2025)

  • Market Cap: A$336.5M
  • Cash (30 June 2025): A$26.6M
  • Shares on Issue: 474M

Trading Implications

  • Fully funded, high-margin project with rapid payback (~11 months in mid-case).
  • Exposure to rising antimony prices (export controls from China since 2024).
  • Production start in Q2 2026 – near-term catalyst.

No material new operational or financial updates outside prior disclosures.

Material Information Summary

Announcement Type: Mineral Resource Estimate (MRE) Update

  • Maiden Inferred Resource:
  • Total: 279.9Mt @ 2.45% TREO Eq (1.16% TREO, 0.20% Nb₂O₅, 177ppm Mo).
  • High-grade zone: 136.5Mt @ 2.93% TREO Eq (1.58% TREO, 0.19% Nb₂O₅, 295ppm Mo).

  • Niobium resource: 143.3Mt @ 0.23% Nb₂O₅ (0.1% cut-off).

  • Expansion Potential:

  • Resource currently includes ~60% of Phase I drilling (11 holes, 5,543m).
  • Full Phase I results (~9,500m) to be incorporated in August 2025 update.

  • Deposit remains open northwest and at depth; Phase II drilling starts Q4 2025.

  • Metallurgy & Infrastructure:

  • Initial Nb₂O₅ recovery: 62.4% (tested); Mo recovery assumed at 80% (untested but mineralogy supports feasibility).
  • Metallurgical testwork expected late August 2025.

  • Located in Namibia with proximity to rail, power, and the port of Walvis Bay.

  • Valuation & Commodity Assumptions:

  • Price assumptions: $60/1% TREO, $55.02/0.1% Nb₂O₅, $56.45/0.1% Mo.

  • TREO Eq formula: Combines TREO, Nb₂O₅, and Mo values with recoveries factored.

  • Next Steps:

  • Completion of pending assays (DD8A, DD8B, DD8C).
  • Expanded drilling campaign at Kameelburg.
  • Geophysical survey and trial drilling at adjacent Omuronga tenement (targeting HREEs).

Key Takeaways for Traders/Investors:

  1. Resource Scale: Large maiden resource with significant high-grade component.
  2. Growth Potential: Upcoming drilling likely to expand tonnage and grade.
  3. Catalysts: Metallurgical results (August) and Phase I MRE update (August).

Omitted: Non-material JORC details, historical exploration, routine operational updates.

This document provides details on CitiFirst Instalment MINIs, which are structured equity derivative products. Below is a concise summary of the material information relevant for trading or capital markets decisions:

Key Features:

  1. Product Type: Instalment MINIs (leveraged equity derivatives with a deferred payment structure).
  2. Current Interest Rate: 8.30% p.a. (applied to the loan component).
  3. Key Components per MINI:
  4. Final Instalment (Loan Amount): The amount due at expiry.
  5. Stop Loss Trigger Level: If the underlying share price falls to this level, the MINI may be terminated early.
  6. Gearing: Loan-to-value ratio (e.g., 50% gearing means the investor pays 50% upfront).
  7. First Instalment (Indicative IM Price): Initial payment required to enter the position.
  8. % from Stop Loss: Distance from the current price to the stop-loss trigger (e.g., 20% means a 20% decline would trigger the stop).
  9. Expiry Date: Maturity date of the MINI.
  10. Indicative Dividend Yield: Estimated yield based on underlying stock dividends.
  11. Treatment of Dividends: Typically "Pay to investor" (investor receives dividends) or "Pay down loan" (dividends reduce loan amount).

Example MINI Terms (Selected Underlyings):

| MINI Code | Underlying | Final Instalment (AUD) | Stop Loss (AUD) | Gearing | First Instalment (AUD) | % from Stop Loss | Expiry | Div Yield | Div Treatment | |-----------|---------------------|------------------------|------------------|---------|------------------------|------------------|--------------|-----------|--------------------| | A2MJOB | A2 Milk Co Ltd | $4.1000 | $7.90 | 43.27% | $4.48 | 48.10% | 26/05/2026 | 1.73% | Pay to investor | | BHPJOA | BHP Group Ltd | $29.1300 | $39.80 | 63.73% | $14.43 | 26.81% | 21/01/2032 | 13.00% | Pay to investor | | CBAJOA | CBA | $140.6800 | $177.34 | 70.91% | $51.59 | 20.67% | 25/09/2025 | 9.21% | Pay to investor | | FMGJOC | Fortescue Metals | $9.2200 | $18.34 | 43.74% | $10.32 | 49.73% | 06/02/2035 | 13.47% | Pay to investor | | WBCJOA | Westpac Banking | $26.5800 | $33.66 | 70.57% | $9.91 | 21.03% | 15/07/2032 | 15.34% | Pay to investor |

Risks & Considerations:

  • Leverage amplifies gains/losses (higher gearing = higher risk).
  • Stop-loss triggers may lead to early termination if the underlying falls sharply.
  • Dividend treatment affects returns (investors either receive dividends or they reduce the loan).

Summary:

This document outlines leveraged investment products tied to ASX-listed stocks, with key terms including gearing, stop-loss levels, and expiry dates. Investors should assess risk tolerance and underlying stock performance before trading. No capital raising or corporate action announcements are included.

  • Disposal Restrictions: 50% of shares acquired post-vesting locked for up to 9 years or until employment cessation; remaining 50% locked for 2 years post-cessation or 9 years.
  • Malus/Clawback: Provisions apply for misconduct or financial misstatements.

  • Record Date for Voting: 8 September 2025 (7:00 PM Sydney time).
  • Voting Exclusions: Votes by MD & CEO (Todd Barlow) or associates disregarded per ASX Listing Rule 14.11.
  • Board Recommendation: Vote in favor (MD & CEO abstaining).
